channel.title: What happpends if
channel.description:
a person handed you a gun, said kill those 2 people over there to survive, there was no way out of it, either kill or be killed, so you kill them he sets you free never to be found again, and the law finds out you've killed them 2 people.
Do you get punished?

item.title: What happpends if
item.dc:creator: @noobie22 Noobie22
item.description:
@noobie22 wrote:

Stupid questions deserve punishment.

Read full topic

item.title: What happpends if
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:17, topic:296887”]If he hands you a gun, they could see that it is not registered to you. Perhaps it’s registered to the loonatic that handed it to you (unlikely though). Also maybe you could give a good description and they could catch the guy. I don’t know theres too many factors involved.

Anyways. There is no mens rea in this situation. They don’t just need evidence that you killed a person, they need evidence that you intended to kill that person (or if there was no intent, that you were reckless enough to get them killed).[/quote]

What if you live in a decent state that doesn’t require gun registration?

Read full topic

item.title: What happpends if
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

If he hands you a gun, they could see that it is not registered to you. Perhaps it’s registered to the loonatic that handed it to you (unlikely though). Also maybe you could give a good description and they could catch the guy. I don’t know theres too many factors involved.

Anyways. There is no mens rea in this situation. They don’t just need evidence that you killed a person, they need evidence that you intended to kill that person (or if there was no intent, that you were reckless enough to get them killed).

Read full topic

item.title: What happpends if
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:1, topic:297465”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=392909.msg2926606#msg2926606 date=1251052956]

This is a legal matter, not a philosophical one so you would be judged in court and seeing as there’s no way to prove your innocence, you’d be punished.

You don’t have to prove your innocence. Your innocent until proven guilty.

If there is evidence of you killing the two person’s, you are proven guilty.
[/quote]

If there is any doubt, you are innocent.[/quote]All defense lawyers have to do is raise probable doubt ^^

Read full topic

item.title: What happpends if
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It could possibly fall under self defense, but you have yourself a pretty good moral dilemma there.

Read full topic

item.title: What happpends if
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:3, topic:296887”]Yes. Unless you can prove you were in danger[/quote]I think even if someone did that and proved they were in danger they wouldn’t care, he still killed two people.

Read full topic

You don’t have to prove your innocence. Your innocent until proven guilty.
[/quote]

Read full topic

@jme wrote:

If he handed me a gun I would just shoot him???

I personally don’t think you would be charged. There’s situations like that where people have been forced to rob banks etc. But they dont get charged.

item.title: What happpends if
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Yes. Unless you can prove you were in danger, you will be prosecuted for double murder. Proving you were in danger is really hard. You didn’t specify the ‘to survive’ part, which makes it hard for me to explain why as there are quite a lot of situations that are possible here. If the person handed you a gun, and pointed another one at your head, you are in danger. But even then, I don’t know how the law thinks about sacrificing one life for two others.

Read full topic

PUNISHMENT.
